intro: Minkelersia pauciflora, commonly known as the sparseflower minkelersia, is a rare flowering plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It is characterized by its low-growing, succulent stems and small, clustered flowers that bloom in shades of yellow and orange. The plant has adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments through its ability to store water in its thick, fleshy leaves. Its flowers are typically pollinated by insects, and it produces small, hard seeds that are dispersed by wind. Due to habitat loss and overcollection, Minkelersia pauciflora is considered vulnerable and is protected in some regions.
